jdrasil.algorithms.lowerbounds

Class ImprovedGraphLowerbound<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdrasil.algorithms.lowerbounds.ImprovedGraphLowerbound<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Integer>, Lowerbound<T>

    public class ImprovedGraphLowerbound<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Lowerbound<T>
    The {k-neighbor / k-path}-improved graph \(H\) of a given graph \(G\) is obtained by adding an edge between all non adjacent vertices that have at least k {common neighbors / vertex disjoint paths}. A crucial lemma states that adding these edges will not increase the tree width. Hence, we can compute a lower bound on the tree width of \(G\) by computing lower bounds on increasing improved graphs of \(G\). In this way, improved graphs can be used to improve the performance of any lower bound algorithm. This class implements the improve graph trick to improve some implemented lower bound algorithms. The implementation is based on Bodlaender and Koster: Treewidth Computations II

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ImprovedGraphLowerbound(Graph<T> graph)
      Standard constructor, just with the graph that should be decomposed.

      • getCurrentSolution

        public java.lang.Integer getCurrentSolution()
        Description copied from interface: Lowerbound
        This method returns the best solution found so far. This method should return null if @see call() was not called, or the algorithm does not found a solution yet, or if the algorithm is not anytime.

      • setContraction

        public void setContraction(boolean contraction)
        The algorithm can use the path-improved graph instead of the neighbor-improved graph. Set this to true to enable the path-improved graph. Attention: computing a path-improved graph is much more time consuming then computing a neighbor-improved graph. (Default: false)
        Parameters:
        contraction -
